intro: Cardiagyris japonica, commonly known as Japanese heartleaf, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
